tag.name: ACT
tag.desc: Act division as in the modern edition.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The number of the act. If the original includes an act division which has been retained, the notation would be thus: </ACT><ACT n="2"> <LD>Actus Secundus</LD>.

tag.name: ABBR
tag.desc: Used to expand old-spelling contractions, e.g. <ABBR expan="the">y<SUP>e</SUP></ABBR>

attribute.name: expan
attribute.desc: The word abbreviated. This will eventually permit searches on the word.

tag.name: ADD
tag.desc: Indicates a passage in an "extended" text that has been added from an alternative version.

tag.name: AMBIG
tag.desc: Designates alternative readings in a modern text where a word in the original is irreducibly ambiguous. Note: this is not a textual variant, but a product of the process of modernization.

tag.name: BACKMATTER
tag.desc: Surrounds all sections of an edition that follow the last scene. The actual division(s) of FRONTMATTER are designated by the <DIV> tag, and include (and replace) such items as Epilogue, List of Characters and so on.

tag.name: BL
tag.depreciated: Use BLL for black letter or L for blank line instead of BL.
tag.desc: Formerly blank line. Depreciated in favour of L.

tag.name: BLL
tag.desc: Black Letter (not to be confused with BL, previously the indication of a blank line).

tag.name: BR
tag.desc: Forces a line break where no other option is available. To be used with caution.

tag.name: C
tag.desc: Centered text. As in HTML this tag applies to a whole line.

tag.name: CL
tag.desc: Closing (e.g. Finis).

tag.name: COL
tag.desc: Defines columns in a page.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: <COL n="0">...</COL> Defines pages with no columns in a document that elsewhere has columns. <COL n="1 | 2">...</COL> Column 1 or 2 (Folio).

tag.name: CW
tag.desc: Catchword

tag.name: DIV
tag.desc: Divisions of the FRONTMATTER and ENDMATTER tags, indicating what kind of material follows.

attribute.name: link
attribute.depreciated: Link attributes should be dropped from the text.

tag.name: EM
tag.desc: Surrounds words to be emphasized. May be replaced by word processor italics.

tag.name: EPILOGUE
tag.depreciated: Use BACKMATTER or DIV instead of EPILOGUE

tag.name: FONTGROUP
tag.desc: This tag allows the editor to fine-tune font size where necessary, as, for example, on a title page.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The normal (default) size is "3", the smallest "1" and the largest "6".

tag.name: FOREIGN
tag.desc: Surrounds a word or phrase in a language other than English. Used for the content of speeches only, not Latin stage directions, literary divisions etc. Example <FOREIGN lang="French">Diable!</FOREIGN>.

attribute.name: lang
attribute.desc: The name of the language used.

tag.name: FRONTMATTER
tag.desc: Surrounds all sections of an edition that precede the first scene. The actual division(s) of FRONTMATTER are designated by the <DIV> tag, and include (and replace) such items as Prologue, Epistle, Dedication and so on.

tag.name: H1
tag.desc: Heading for scenes in the modern text.

tag.name: H2
tag.desc: Heading for scenes in the modern text.

tag.name: H3
tag.desc: Heading for scenes in the modern text.

tag.name: H4
tag.desc: Heading for scenes in the modern text.

tag.name: H5
tag.desc: Heading for scenes in the modern text.

tag.name: H6
tag.desc: Heading for scenes in the modern text.

tag.name: HW
tag.desc: Hung Word(s). Note that the hung word should be restored to the line it continues; the "type" indicates whether it was originally displaced to the previous or next line.

attribute.name: t
attribute.desc: The type of hung word indicates whether it appears on the previous or next line from the line it continues.

tag.name: I
tag.desc: Italic text. Italics may also be generated in the normal word processor way to assist you in working with a readable text; they will later be converted automatically.

tag.name: INDENT
tag.desc: Surrounds a passage indented in the original.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: Indicates the number of em spaces a block of text (verse or prose) is to be indented.

tag.name: J
tag.desc: Justified line(s). Only fully justified lines are tagged. Note that verse lines that reach to the end of the column should not be tagged as justified (though many draft texts do), since these are not justified in the way that prose lines are.

tag.name: L
tag.desc: Blank line in the old-spelling texts. (Previously tagged <L></L> and even earlier <BL>.)

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: A line in the modern text, with its line number, each scene renumbered from 1.

attribute.name: part
attribute.desc: See Editor Guidelines 4.4.8 on division into lines. Part may optionally be indicated by tabs: one tab = medial, two tabs = final.

tag.name: LB
tag.depreciated: Use L for lineation instead of LB.
tag.desc: Previously used for line break. <L/> is recommended.

tag.name: LD
tag.desc: Literary Division (e.g. Act, Scene.). Note that this tag encloses original literary divisions; modern divisions are indicated by separate tags

tag.name: LEM
tag.desc: Surrounds the lemma for an annotation or collation. The lemma will become the link on the text, and must be wholly accurate, including final punctuation.

tag.name: LINEGROUP
tag.desc: Surrounds a pattern of rhyming verse.

attribute.name: form
attribute.desc: The form of the rhyme.

attribute.name: rhyme
attribute.desc: The group's rhyming pattern, for example aabbcddc

tag.name: LN
tag.desc: The line numbers from the modern edition to which a collation or note is linked. The format follows the MLA style: 1.3.33, for example.

tag.name: LS
tag.desc: Surrounds letter-spaced words (e.g., "G O D").

tag.name: MARG
tag.desc: Marginalia

attribute.name: loc
attribute.desc: "left" or "right". Which page margin this text appears in

tag.name: MODE
tag.desc: Indicator of verse or prose.

attribute.name: t
attribute.desc: Note that you may choose to use a type of "uncertain" where it is not clear that the section is either verse or prose.

tag.name: note
tag.desc: Surrounds the note.

tag.name: ORNAMENT
tag.desc: Self-closing <ORNAMENT /> is a printer's ornament. <ORNAMENT> </ORNAMENT> is used for decorative or large font letters only.

attribute.name: drop
attribute.desc: Marks this ornament as a drop-capital, and specifies the number of lines to span.

attribute.name: letter
attribute.desc: The oranmented letter.

tag.name: PAGE
tag.desc: Indicates page breaks in the old-spelling texts.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The "through page number" for the text.

tag.name: PN
tag.desc: Page number as printed.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: Actual page number where it differs from the printed number.

tag.name: POEM
tag.depreciated: Use DIV with a name attrbute instead of POEM

tag.name: PROLOGUE
tag.depreciated: Use FRONTMATTER or DIV instead of PROLOGUE

tag.name: PROP
tag.desc: Surrounds an annotation that provides information about props to be used in the play, in the location they are needed.

attribute.name: item
attribute.desc: A one-word indication of the nature of the item. Where there are more than one in the play (in the case of multiple letters, for example) these should be designate "letter 1" "letter 2" etc.

attribute.name: desc
attribute.desc: A short description of the prop, if needed.

tag.name: PROSEQUOTE
tag.desc: Formerly a prose quotation (e.g. quoted letter).

attribute.name: source
attribute.desc: When the passage is a quotation from another source, the source should be recorded.

tag.name: QLN
tag.desc: quarto line number

tag.name: R
tag.desc: Roman type. This tag is used only in texts where the default font is black letter.

tag.name: RA
tag.desc: Right Aligned text. This tag can be applied to a separate part of a line, so is the equivalent of a tab rather than right alignment for the whole line.

tag.name: RDG
tag.desc: The reading of an editor or edition for an entry in the collation. One collation may contain multiple variant readings.

attribute.name: resp
attribute.desc: The edition or editor responsible for the reading.

tag.name: RT
tag.desc: Running title.

tag.name: RULE
tag.desc: A horizontal rule. The tag is self-closing.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: Width of the rule in m-spaces. The default is a full width rule.

tag.name: S
tag.desc: Speech. Includes the speech prefix and any included stage directions (</S> may appear at the end of a hung word).

tag.name: SCENE
tag.desc: Scene division as in the modern edition. Note: In plays with a non-diegetic chorus, like Henry V (F) and Pericles, use <SCENE n="0"> to designate chorus passages that are not prologues or epilogues. SCENEs may be used with or without enclosing ACTs.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The number of the scene.

attribute.name: link
attribute.depreciated: Link attributes should be dropped from the text.

tag.name: SD
tag.desc: Stage Direction. Each line of a split direction in the right hand margin should be tagged separately; directions different in kind should also be tagged separately.

attribute.name: t
attribute.desc: The type of the stage direction, a comma-separated list.

tag.name: SECTION
tag.depreciated: Use DIV with a name attrbute instead of SECTION.
tag.desc: Previously used as section divisions in essays and supplementary works.

tag.name: SIG
tag.desc:
Page Signature (encloses the printed signature, and appears at the end of the page, where it will be displayed). Note that the signature itself may include other tags where necessary (if, for example, an italic letter is used). Examples:
aaa

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The signature in its normalized and accurate form. This will include all signatures that are implied rather than actually printed, and must include either "r" or "v" for recto and verso.

tag.name: SP
tag.desc: Normalized form of the name; must be included in every instance of a speech prefix, but not if the name is used in the course of a speech. Example: <SP norm="Hamlet">Ham.</SP>. Where there are more than one speaker, separate the normalized names by commas; if there is a speech without a speech prefix, put<SP norm="normalized name"></SP> to indicate its omission.

attribute.name: norm
attribute.desc: Normalized form of the name; must be included in every instance of a speech prefix, but not in the course of a speech.

tag.name: SPACE
tag.desc: Indicates significant space to be left in the text. The most common instance of this will be in formatting the lines of verse in a song or sonnet, where some lines will be indented further than others.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The number of m-spaces should be indicated.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The number of the stanza.

tag.name: SUB
tag.desc: Subscript characters.

tag.name: SUP
tag.desc: Superscript characters.

tag.name: SWASH
tag.desc: Indicates an ornamental swash letter. DRE texts only.

attribute.name: where
attribute.desc: The direction of the swash ornament.

tag.name: TITLEHEAD
tag.desc: Title page material in quartos; initial heading in Folio.

tag.name: TITLEPAGE
tag.depreciated: Use DIV with a name attrbute instead of TITLEPAGE

tag.name: TLN
tag.desc: Through Line Number. The basic method of internal reference for the editions will be the TLN number. Where a quarto or modern edition omits material the numbers will be omitted; where they add material the numbers will be added decimally (<TLN n="1033.1"> etc.); where the line division varies from the Folio the TLN number will be that of the first word of the line.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The TLN.

tag.name: VERSEQUOTE
tag.desc: Previously used for a verse quotation (e.g. song).

attribute.name: source
attribute.desc: When the verse is a quotation from another source, the source should be recorded (as in Pistol's quotations from earlier plays).

tag.name: WLN
tag.desc: Witness Line Number.

attribute.name: n
attribute.desc: The WLN.

tag.name: WORK
tag.desc: The tag that surrounds the entire document.

attribute.name: genre
attribute.depreciated: Use metadata instead of the genre attribute.
attribute.desc: Previously used to decribe the work's genre.
